datafield.subfield: Amy Lambeck Young and Amy Lynne Young both hold advanced degrees in anthropology or archaeology granted in the 1990's; both have produced works on the archaeology of the eastern United States.
Risk and material conditions of African American slaves at Locust Grove, 1995:

(Amy Lambeck Young; Ph.D., Univ. of Tenn., Knoxville, 1995) vita (b. 3/7/56 in Jacksonville, Fla.; B.A. in Anthropology, Univ. of Louisville, 1988; master's degree, Univ. of Tenn, Knoxville, 1991; faculty member, Univ. of Mississippi in Hattiesburg)
(hdg.: Young, Amy L.; usage: Amy Young; Amy L. Young; Amy Lambeck Young)
